extract-structured-data.description: Extract structured data from provided text,image or PDF.

props.name: model
props.description: The model which will generate the completion. Some models are suitable for natural language tasks, others specialize in code.

props.name: text
props.description: Text to extract structured data from.

props.name: image
props.description: Image or PDF to extract structured data from.

props.name: schema
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: name
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: description
props.description: Brief description of the data, this hints for the AI on what to look for

props.name: maxTokens
props.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Requests can use up to 2,048 or 4,096 tokens shared between prompt and completion, don't set the value to maximum and leave some tokens for the input. The exact limit varies by model. (One token is roughly 4 characters for normal English text)

props.name: model
props.description: The model which will generate the completion. Some models are suitable for natural language tasks, others specialize in code.

props.name: temperature
props.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

props.name: maxTokens
props.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Requests can use up to 2,048 or 4,096 tokens shared between prompt and completion, don't set the value to maximum and leave some tokens for the input. The exact limit varies by model. (One token is roughly 4 characters for normal English text)

props.name: image
props.description: URL of image to be used as input for the model.

props.name: roles
props.description: Array of roles to specify more accurate response.Please check [guide to Input Messages](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/api/messages-examples#vision).

props.name: thinkingMode
props.description: Uses claude 3.7 sonnet enhanced reasoning capabilities for complex tasks.

props.name: thinkingModeParams
props.description: This parameter determines the maximum number of tokens Claude is allowed to use for its internal reasoning process.Your budget tokens must always be less than the max tokens specified.
